articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A Gaza health ministry spokesman said hundreds were killed in a blast at a Gaza City hospital that Israeli and Palestinian officials blamed on each other and that ignited protests in the West Bank and around the Middle East.
articles.title: Israel and Hamas at war: Latest news

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Members of the Organisation of Islamic Cooperation (OIC) should impose an oil embargo and other sanctions on Israel and expel all Israeli ambassadors, Iranian Foreign Minister Hossein Amirabdollahian said on Wednesday.
articles.title: Iran calls for Islamic countries to sanction Israel

articles.author: Pesha Magid
articles.description: McDonald's (MCD.N) franchises in some Muslim countries disavowed a move by the company's Israeli restaurants to give free meals to the Israeli military, highlighting the polarized regional politics that global corporations navigate during war.
articles.title: Free meals for Israeli soldiers divide McDonald's franchises

articles.author: Kanishka Singh
articles.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Tuesday cited a marked rise in antisemitism in Canada following Palestinian Islamist group Hamas' attack on Israel and Israel's subsequent deadly air strikes in Gaza.
articles.title: Trudeau says Canada faces 'scary rise' in antisemitism after war in Middle East

articles.author: Hannah Lang
articles.description: A bipartisan group of lawmakers is urging the Biden administration to swiftly crack down on the use of cryptocurrencies by Hamas and its affiliates following the Palestinian militant group's deadly attack in Israel earlier this month.
articles.title: Lawmakers urge White House to crackdown on Hamas use of crypto after Israel attack

articles.author: Michelle Nichols
articles.description: The United Nations Security Council will now vote on Wednesday on a Brazilian-drafted resolution that calls for humanitarian pauses in the conflict between Israel and Palestinian militants Hamas to allow humanitarian aid access to the Gaza Strip.
articles.title: UN Security Council to vote Wednesday on Israel-Gaza conflict

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: British foreign minister James Cleverly is expected to travel to the Middle East soon, including visits to Egypt and possibly Qatar and Turkey, a British source said on Wednesday.
articles.title: British foreign minister expected to travel to Middle East soon - UK source

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Steve Holland
articles.description: U.S. President Joe Biden flies to Israel on Wednesday to signal support for its war against Hamas after a deadly blast at a Gaza City hospital inflamed tensions and led to the cancellation of his planned summit with Arab leaders.
articles.title: Biden heads to Middle East inflamed by Gaza hospital blast

articles.author: Dan Williams
articles.description: One Israeli cabinet minister was barred from a hospital visitors' entrance. Another's bodyguards were drenched with coffee thrown by a bereaved man. A third had "traitor" and "imbecile" shouted at her as she came to comfort families evacuated during the horror.
articles.title: Whatever unfolds in Gaza war, judgment day looms for Netanyahu

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: The U.S. military thwarted an attack targeting its forces in Iraq early on Wednesday, intercepting two drones before they could strike, two U.S. officials told Reuters.
articles.title: U.S. says thwarts drone attack on its troops in Iraq
